title: Pleas for Peace.

nodes.title: Albert Camus
nodes.content: Peace is the only battle worth waging.

nodes.title: Dietrich Bonhoeffer
nodes.content: Silence in the face of evil is itself evil: God will not hold us guiltless. Not to speak is to speak. Not to act is to act.

nodes.title: Howard Zinn
nodes.content: If you join a fight for social justice you may win or lose, but just by being part of the struggle, you win, and your life will be better for it.

nodes.title: Martin Luther King Jr.
nodes.content: Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal.

nodes.title: Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit
nodes.content: The more we sweat in peace, the less we bleed in war.

nodes.title: Blanche Prichard McCrum
nodes.content: Peace, like war, must be waged

nodes.title: Aziz Abu Sarah
nodes.content: I believe that if you're not doing something, then you accept reality, and if you accept reality, then you agree with the fact that the only solution is for us to keep killing each other... One should do whatever he or she can to change the situation.

nodes.title: Spinoza
nodes.content: Peace is not the absence of war; it is a virtue; a state of mind; a disposition for benevolence; confidence; and justice.

nodes.title: August 28th, 1963
nodes.content: More than 200,000 people of all races congregate in Washington D.C. (USA) for the peaceful march that promoted civil rights legislation. Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his famous 'I Have a Dream' speech.

nodes.title: International Day of Peace (21 September)
nodes.content: Proclaimed in 1981 by the UN General Assembly to be observed as a day of global ceasefire and non-violence, an invitation to all nations and people to honour a cessation of hostilities throughout the day.

nodes.title: International Day of United Nations Peacekeepers (29 May)
nodes.content: Designated in 2002 by the UN to pay tribute to all the men and women who have served in UN peacekeeping operations for their high level of professionalism, dedication and courage, and to honour the memory of those who have lost their lives in the cause of peace.

nodes.title: World Day for Cultural Diversity for Dialogue and Development (21 May)
nodes.content: Proclaimed in 2002 by the UN to protect cultural diversity as a means of achieving prosperity, sustainable development and global peaceful coexistence.

nodes.title: 22nd July, 1833
nodes.content: Slavery Abolition Act is passed in unopposed in the House of Commons (UK).

I believe that if you're not doing something, then you accept reality, and if you accept reality, then you agree with the fact that the only solution is for us to keep killing each other. It's hard for me to understand how you can accept something like that. One should do whatever he or she can to change the situation. Even if there is a tiny bit of hope, I think it is better to try to do something than sit there and do nothing.
Peace is not the absence of war; it is a virtue; a state of mind; a disposition for benevolence; confidence; and justice.
